intro: Brachistus leptocaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed brachistus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
